00019 /*! \file
00020  *
00021  * \brief Provide Cryptographic Signature capability
00022  *
00023  * \author Mark Spencer <markster@digium.com> 
00024  *
00025  * \extref Uses the OpenSSL library, available at
00026  * http://www.openssl.org/
00027  */
00028 
00029 /*** MODULEINFO
00030    <depend>ssl</depend>
00031  ***/
00032 
00033 #include "asterisk.h"
00034 
00035 ASTERISK_FILE_VERSION(__FILE__, "$Revision$")
00036

00049 #include "asterisk/logger.h"

00059 
00060 /*
00061  * Asterisk uses RSA keys with SHA-1 message digests for its
00062  * digital signatures.  The choice of RSA is due to its higher
00063  * throughput on verification, and the choice of SHA-1 based
00064  * on the recently discovered collisions in MD5's compression 
00065  * algorithm and recommendations of avoiding MD5 in new schemes
00066  * from various industry experts.
00067  *
00068  * We use OpenSSL to provide our crypto routines, although we never
00069  * actually use full-up SSL
00070  *
00071  */
00072 
00073 /*
00074  * XXX This module is not very thread-safe.  It is for everyday stuff
00075  *     like reading keys and stuff, but there are all kinds of weird
00076  *     races with people running reload and key init at the same time
00077  *     for example
00078  *
00079  * XXXX
00080  */
00081 
00082 AST_MUTEX_DEFINE_STATIC(keylock);
00083 
00084 #define KEY_NEEDS_PASSCODE (1 << 16)
00085 
00086 struct ast_key {
00087    /* Name of entity */
00088    char name[80];
00089    /* File name */
00090    char fn[256];
00091    /* Key type (AST_KEY_PUB or AST_KEY_PRIV, along with flags from above) */
00092    int ktype;
00093    /* RSA structure (if successfully loaded) */
00094    RSA *rsa;
00095    /* Whether we should be deleted */
00096    int delme;
00097    /* FD for input (or -1 if no input allowed, or -2 if we needed input) */
00098    int infd;
00099    /* FD for output */
00100    int outfd;
00101    /* Last MD5 Digest */
00102    unsigned char digest[16];
00103    struct ast_key *next;
00104 };
00105 
00106 static struct ast_key *keys = NULL;
00107

00109 #if 0
00110 static int fdprint(int fd, char *s)
00111 {
00112         return write(fd, s, strlen(s) + 1);
00113 }
00114 #endif
00115 static int pw_cb(char *buf, int size, int rwflag, void *userdata)
00116 {
00117    struct ast_key *key = (struct ast_key *)userdata;
00118    char prompt[256];
00119    int res;
00120    int tmp;
00121    if (key->infd > -1) {
00122       snprintf(prompt, sizeof(prompt), ">>>> passcode for %s key '%s': ",
00123           key->ktype == AST_KEY_PRIVATE ? "PRIVATE" : "PUBLIC", key->name);
00124       write(key->outfd, prompt, strlen(prompt));
00125       memset(buf, 0, sizeof(buf));
00126       tmp = ast_hide_password(key->infd);
00127       memset(buf, 0, size);
00128       res = read(key->infd, buf, size);
00129       ast_restore_tty(key->infd, tmp);
00130       if (buf[strlen(buf) -1] == '\n')
00131          buf[strlen(buf) - 1] = '\0';
00132       return strlen(buf);
00133    } else {
00134       /* Note that we were at least called */
00135       key->infd = -2;
00136    }
00137    return -1;
00138 }
00139 
00140 static struct ast_key *__ast_key_get(const char *kname, int ktype)
00141 {
00142    struct ast_key *key;
00143    ast_mutex_lock(&keylock);
00144    key = keys;
00145    while(key) {
00146       if (!strcmp(kname, key->name) &&
00147           (ktype == key->ktype))
00148          break;
00149       key = key->next;
00150    }
00151    ast_mutex_unlock(&keylock);
00152    return key;
00153 }
00154 
00155 static struct ast_key *try_load_key (char *dir, char *fname, int ifd, int ofd, int *not2)
00156 {
00157    int ktype = 0;
00158    char *c = NULL;
00159    char ffname[256];
00160    unsigned char digest[16];
00161    FILE *f;
00162    struct MD5Context md5;
00163    struct ast_key *key;
00164    static int notice = 0;
00165    int found = 0;
00166 
00167    /* Make sure its name is a public or private key */
00168 
00169    if ((c = strstr(fname, ".pub")) && !strcmp(c, ".pub")) {
00170       ktype = AST_KEY_PUBLIC;
00171    } else if ((c = strstr(fname, ".key")) && !strcmp(c, ".key")) {
00172       ktype = AST_KEY_PRIVATE;
00173    } else
00174       return NULL;
00175 
00176    /* Get actual filename */
00177    snprintf(ffname, sizeof(ffname), "%s/%s", dir, fname);
00178 
00179    ast_mutex_lock(&keylock);
00180    key = keys;
00181    while(key) {
00182       /* Look for an existing version already */
00183       if (!strcasecmp(key->fn, ffname)) 
00184          break;
00185       key = key->next;
00186    }
00187    ast_mutex_unlock(&keylock);
00188 
00189    /* Open file */
00190    f = fopen(ffname, "r");
00191    if (!f) {
00192       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to open key file %s: %s\n", ffname, strerror(errno));
00193       return NULL;
00194    }
00195    MD5Init(&md5);
00196    while(!feof(f)) {
00197       /* Calculate a "whatever" quality md5sum of the key */
00198       char buf[256];
00199       memset(buf, 0, 256);
00200       fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), f);
00201       if (!feof(f)) {
00202          MD5Update(&md5, (unsigned char *) buf, strlen(buf));
00203       }
00204    }
00205    MD5Final(digest, &md5);
00206    if (key) {
00207       /* If the MD5 sum is the same, and it isn't awaiting a passcode 
00208          then this is far enough */
00209       if (!memcmp(digest, key->digest, 16) &&
00210           !(key->ktype & KEY_NEEDS_PASSCODE)) {
00211          fclose(f);
00212          key->delme = 0;
00213          return NULL;
00214       } else {
00215          /* Preserve keytype */
00216          ktype = key->ktype;
00217          /* Recycle the same structure */
00218          found++;
00219       }
00220    }
00221 
00222    /* Make fname just be the normal name now */
00223    *c = '\0';
00224    if (!key) {
00225       if (!(key = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*key)))) {
00226          fclose(f);
00227          return NULL;
00228       }
00229    }
00230    /* At this point we have a key structure (old or new).  Time to
00231       fill it with what we know */
00232    /* Gotta lock if this one already exists */
00233    if (found)
00234       ast_mutex_lock(&keylock);
00235    /* First the filename */
00236    ast_copy_string(key->fn, ffname, sizeof(key->fn));
00237    /* Then the name */
00238    ast_copy_string(key->name, fname, sizeof(key->name));
00239    key->ktype = ktype;
00240    /* Yes, assume we're going to be deleted */
00241    key->delme = 1;
00242    /* Keep the key type */
00243    memcpy(key->digest, digest, 16);
00244    /* Can I/O takes the FD we're given */
00245    key->infd = ifd;
00246    key->outfd = ofd;
00247    /* Reset the file back to the beginning */
00248    rewind(f);
00249    /* Now load the key with the right method */
00250    if (ktype == AST_KEY_PUBLIC)
00251       key->rsa = PEM_read_RSA_PUBKEY(f, NULL, pw_cb, key);
00252    else
00253       key->rsa = PEM_read_RSAPrivateKey(f, NULL, pw_cb, key);
00254    fclose(f);
00255    if (key->rsa) {
00256       if (RSA_size(key->rsa) == 128) {
00257          /* Key loaded okay */
00258          key->ktype &= ~KEY_NEEDS_PASSCODE;
00259          if (option_verbose > 2)
00260             ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Loaded %s key '%s'\n", key->ktype == AST_KEY_PUBLIC ? "PUBLIC" : "PRIVATE", key->name);
00261          if (option_debug)
00262             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Key '%s' loaded OK\n", key->name);
00263          key->delme = 0;
00264       } else
00265          ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Key '%s' is not expected size.\n", key->name);
00266    } else if (key->infd != -2) {
00267       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Key load %s '%s' failed\n",key->ktype == AST_KEY_PUBLIC ? "PUBLIC" : "PRIVATE", key->name);
00268       if (ofd > -1) {
00269          ERR_print_errors_fp(stderr);
00270       } else
00271          ERR_print_errors_fp(stderr);
00272    } else {
00273       ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Key '%s' needs passcode.\n", key->name);
00274       key->ktype |= KEY_NEEDS_PASSCODE;
00275       if (!notice) {
00276          if (!ast_opt_init_keys) 
00277             ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Add the '-i' flag to the asterisk command line if you want to automatically initialize passcodes at launch.\n");
00278          notice++;
00279       }
00280       /* Keep it anyway */
00281       key->delme = 0;
00282       /* Print final notice about "init keys" when done */
00283       *not2 = 1;
00284    }
00285    if (found)
00286       ast_mutex_unlock(&keylock);
00287    if (!found) {
00288       ast_mutex_lock(&keylock);
00289       key->next = keys;
00290       keys = key;
00291       ast_mutex_unlock(&keylock);
00292    }
00293    return key;
00294 }

00300    int x; 
00301    for (x=0;x<len;x++)
00302       printf("%02x", *(src++));
00303    printf("\n");

00306 static char *binary(int y, int len)
00307 {
00308    static char res[80];
00309    int x;
00310    memset(res, 0, sizeof(res));
00311    for (x=0;x<len;x++) {
00312       if (y & (1 << x))
00313          res[(len - x - 1)] = '1';
00314       else
00315          res[(len - x - 1)] = '0';
00316    }
00317    return res;
00318 }
00319 
00320 #endif
00321 
00322 static int __ast_sign_bin(struct ast_key *key, const char *msg, int msglen, unsigned char *dsig)
00323 {
00324    unsigned char digest[20];
00325    unsigned int siglen = 128;
00326    int res;
00327 
00328    if (key->ktype != AST_KEY_PRIVATE) {
00329       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Cannot sign with a public key\n");
00330       return -1;
00331    }
00332 
00333    /* Calculate digest of message */
00334    SHA1((unsigned char *)msg, msglen, digest);
00335 
00336    /* Verify signature */
00337    res = RSA_sign(NID_sha1, digest, sizeof(digest), dsig, &siglen, key->rsa);
00338    
00339    if (!res) {
00340       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "RSA Signature (key %s) failed\n", key->name);
00341       return -1;
00342    }
00343 
00344    if (siglen != 128) {
00345       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unexpected signature length %d, expecting %d\n", (int)siglen, (int)128);
00346       return -1;
00347    }
00348 
00349    return 0;
00350    
00351 }
00352 
00353 static int __ast_decrypt_bin(unsigned char *dst, const unsigned char *src, int srclen, struct ast_key *key)
00354 {
00355    int res;
00356    int pos = 0;
00357    if (key->ktype != AST_KEY_PRIVATE) {
00358       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Cannot decrypt with a public key\n");
00359       return -1;
00360    }
00361 
00362    if (srclen % 128) {
00363       ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Tried to decrypt something not a multiple of 128 bytes\n");
00364       return -1;
00365    }
00366    while(srclen) {
00367       /* Process chunks 128 bytes at a time */
00368       res = RSA_private_decrypt(128, src, dst, key->rsa, RSA_PKCS1_OAEP_PADDING);
00369       if (res < 0)
00370          return -1;
00371       pos += res;
00372       src += 128;
00373       srclen -= 128;
00374       dst += res;
00375    }
00376    return pos;
00377 }
00378 
00379 static int __ast_encrypt_bin(unsigned char *dst, const unsigned char *src, int srclen, struct ast_key *key)
00380 {
00381    int res;
00382    int bytes;
00383    int pos = 0;
00384    if (key->ktype != AST_KEY_PUBLIC) {
00385       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Cannot encrypt with a private key\n");
00386       return -1;
00387    }
00388    
00389    while(srclen) {
00390       bytes = srclen;
00391       if (bytes > 128 - 41)
00392          bytes = 128 - 41;
00393       /* Process chunks 128-41 bytes at a time */
00394       res = RSA_public_encrypt(bytes, src, dst, key->rsa, RSA_PKCS1_OAEP_PADDING);
00395       if (res != 128) {
00396          ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "How odd, encrypted size is %d\n", res);
00397          return -1;
00398       }
00399       src += bytes;
00400       srclen -= bytes;
00401       pos += res;
00402       dst += res;
00403    }
00404    return pos;
00405 }
00406 
00407 static int __ast_sign(struct ast_key *key, char *msg, char *sig)
00408 {
00409    unsigned char dsig[128];
00410    int siglen = sizeof(dsig);
00411    int res;
00412    res = ast_sign_bin(key, msg, strlen(msg), dsig);
00413    if (!res)
00414       /* Success -- encode (256 bytes max as documented) */
00415       ast_base64encode(sig, dsig, siglen, 256);
00416    return res;
00417    
00418 }
00419 
00420 static int __ast_check_signature_bin(struct ast_key *key, const char *msg, int msglen, const unsigned char *dsig)
00421 {
00422    unsigned char digest[20];
00423    int res;
00424 
00425    if (key->ktype != AST_KEY_PUBLIC) {
00426       /* Okay, so of course you really *can* but for our purposes
00427          we're going to say you can't */
00428       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Cannot check message signature with a private key\n");
00429       return -1;
00430    }
00431 
00432    /* Calculate digest of message */
00433    SHA1((unsigned char *)msg, msglen, digest);
00434 
00435    /* Verify signature */
00436    res = RSA_verify(NID_sha1, digest, sizeof(digest), (unsigned char *)dsig, 128, key->rsa);
00437    
00438    if (!res) {
00439       if (option_debug)
00440          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Key failed verification: %s\n", key->name);
00441       return -1;
00442    }
00443    /* Pass */
00444    return 0;
00445 }
00446 
00447 static int __ast_check_signature(struct ast_key *key, const char *msg, const char *sig)
00448 {
00449    unsigned char dsig[128];
00450    int res;
00451 
00452    /* Decode signature */
00453    res = ast_base64decode(dsig, sig, sizeof(dsig));
00454    if (res != sizeof(dsig)) {
00455       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Signature improper length (expect %d, got %d)\n", (int)sizeof(dsig), (int)res);
00456       return -1;
00457    }
00458    res = ast_check_signature_bin(key, msg, strlen(msg), dsig);
00459    return res;
00460 }
00461 
00462 static void crypto_load(int ifd, int ofd)
00463 {
00464    struct ast_key *key, *nkey, *last;
00465    DIR *dir = NULL;
00466    struct dirent *ent;
00467    int note = 0;
00468    /* Mark all keys for deletion */
00469    ast_mutex_lock(&keylock);
00470    key = keys;
00471    while(key) {
00472       key->delme = 1;
00473       key = key->next;
00474    }
00475    ast_mutex_unlock(&keylock);
00476    /* Load new keys */
00477    dir = opendir((char *)ast_config_AST_KEY_DIR);
00478    if (dir) {
00479       while((ent = readdir(dir))) {
00480          try_load_key((char *)ast_config_AST_KEY_DIR, ent->d_name, ifd, ofd, &note);
00481       }
00482       closedir(dir);
00483    } else
00484       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to open key directory '%s'\n", (char *)ast_config_AST_KEY_DIR);
00485    if (note) {
00486       ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Please run the command 'init keys' to enter the passcodes for the keys\n");
00487    }
00488    ast_mutex_lock(&keylock);
00489    key = keys;
00490    last = NULL;
00491    while(key) {
00492       nkey = key->next;
00493       if (key->delme) {
00494          if (option_debug)
00495             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Deleting key %s type %d\n", key->name, key->ktype);
00496          /* Do the delete */
00497          if (last)
00498             last->next = nkey;
00499          else
00500             keys = nkey;
00501          if (key->rsa)
00502             RSA_free(key->rsa);
00503          free(key);
00504       } else 
00505          last = key;
00506       key = nkey;
00507    }
00508    ast_mutex_unlock(&keylock);
00509 }
00510 
00511 static void md52sum(char *sum, unsigned char *md5)
00512 {
00513    int x;
00514    for (x=0;x<16;x++) 
00515       sum += sprintf(sum, "%02x", *(md5++));
00516 }
00517 
00518 static int show_keys(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
00519 {
00520    struct ast_key *key;
00521    char sum[16 * 2 + 1];
00522    int count_keys = 0;
00523 
00524    ast_mutex_lock(&keylock);
00525    key = keys;
00526    ast_cli(fd, "%-18s %-8s %-16s %-33s\n", "Key Name", "Type", "Status", "Sum");
00527    while(key) {
00528       md52sum(sum, key->digest);
00529       ast_cli(fd, "%-18s %-8s %-16s %-33s\n", key->name, 
00530          (key->ktype & 0xf) == AST_KEY_PUBLIC ? "PUBLIC" : "PRIVATE",
00531          key->ktype & KEY_NEEDS_PASSCODE ? "[Needs Passcode]" : "[Loaded]", sum);
00532             
00533       key = key->next;
00534       count_keys++;
00535    }
00536    ast_mutex_unlock(&keylock);
00537    ast_cli(fd, "%d known RSA keys.\n", count_keys);
00538    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
00539 }
00540 
00541 static int init_keys(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
00542 {
00543    struct ast_key *key;
00544    int ign;
00545    char *kn;
00546    char tmp[256] = "";
00547 
00548    key = keys;
00549    while(key) {
00550       /* Reload keys that need pass codes now */
00551       if (key->ktype & KEY_NEEDS_PASSCODE) {
00552          kn = key->fn + strlen(ast_config_AST_KEY_DIR) + 1;
00553          ast_copy_string(tmp, kn, sizeof(tmp));
00554          try_load_key((char *)ast_config_AST_KEY_DIR, tmp, fd, fd, &ign);
00555       }
00556       key = key->next;
00557    }
00558    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
00559 }

00561 static const char show_key_usage[] =
00562 "Usage: keys show\n"
00563 "       Displays information about RSA keys known by Asterisk\n";
00564 
00565 static const char init_keys_usage[] =
00566 "Usage: keys init\n"
00567 "       Initializes private keys (by reading in pass code from the user)\n";
00568 
00569 static struct ast_cli_entry cli_crypto[] = {
00570    { { "keys", "show", NULL },
00571    show_keys, "Displays RSA key information",
00572    show_key_usage },
00573 
00574    { { "keys", "init", NULL },
00575    init_keys, "Initialize RSA key passcodes",
00576    init_keys_usage },
00577 };

00579 static int crypto_init(void)
00580 {
00581    SSL_library_init();
00582    ERR_load_crypto_strings();
00583    ast_cli_register_multiple(cli_crypto, sizeof(cli_crypto) / sizeof(struct ast_cli_entry));
00584 
00585    /* Install ourselves into stubs */
00586    ast_key_get = __ast_key_get;
00587    ast_check_signature = __ast_check_signature;
00588    ast_check_signature_bin = __ast_check_signature_bin;
00589    ast_sign = __ast_sign;
00590    ast_sign_bin = __ast_sign_bin;
00591    ast_encrypt_bin = __ast_encrypt_bin;
00592    ast_decrypt_bin = __ast_decrypt_bin;
00593    return 0;
00594 }
00595 
00596 static int reload(void)
00597 {
00598    crypto_load(-1, -1);
00599    return 0;
00600 }
00601 
00602 static int load_module(void)
00603 {
00604    crypto_init();
00605    if (ast_opt_init_keys)
00606       crypto_load(STDIN_FILENO, STDOUT_FILENO);
00607    else
00608       crypto_load(-1, -1);
00609    return 0;
00610 }
00611 
00612 static int unload_module(void)
00613 {
00614    /* Can't unload this once we're loaded */
00615    return -1;
00616 }
00617 
00618 /* needs usecount semantics defined */
00619 AST_MODULE_INFO(ASTERISK_GPL_KEY, AST_MODFLAG_DEFAULT, "Cryptographic Digital Signatures",
00620       .load = load_module,
00621       .unload = unload_module,
00622       .reload = reload
00623    );
